basics.name: Ruolin Shi (石若琳)
basics.summary: Currently pursuing a Ph.D. degree in Transportation at Tongji University, Shanghai, China, under the supervision of Prof. Xuesong Wang. Research interests lie in decision-making and motion planning for automated vehicles, trajectory prediction, and digital traffic rules.

publications.name: RuleNet: rule-priority-aware multi-agent trajectory prediction in ambiguous traffic scenarios
publications.publisher: Transportation Research Part C: Emerging Technologies
publications.summary: RuleNet is a specialized framework for safety-aware multi-agent trajectory prediction that combines graph attention networks with rule-based robustness attention mechanisms to simultaneously predict future trajectories of multiple traffic participants while evaluating trajectory safety.

publications.name: Digitizing traffic rules to guide automated vehicle trajectory planning
publications.summary: This paper presents a comprehensive framework for digitizing traffic rules to guide automated vehicle trajectory planning, integrating rule-based constraints with motion planning algorithms to enable automated vehicles to make safe and rule-compliant trajectory decisions.

publications.name: Conflict extraction and characteristics analysis at signalized intersections using trajectory data
publications.publisher: International Journal of Transportation Science and Technology
publications.summary: This paper presents a comprehensive framework for extracting and analyzing traffic conflicts at signalized intersections using high-resolution trajectory data, focusing on conflict extraction methods and characteristics analysis for intersection safety improvement.

publications.name: Examining causal factors of traffic conflicts at intersections using vehicle trajectory data
publications.publisher: International Journal of Transportation Science and Technology
publications.summary: This paper examines causal factors of traffic conflicts at intersections using vehicle trajectory data, providing insights into conflict mechanisms and contributing to intersection safety analysis.
